channel.title: Problem with linux - shift, ctrl, alt etc keys not working
channel.description:
So a few weeks ago I bought a new keyboard, the Zowie Celeritas, and I was quite disappointed to find out some of the keys don't work in Linux.
https://bugs.archlinux.org/task/24505
There's a bug report for Arch Linux that someone else with the same keyboard posted, the bug was closed and redirected to bugzilla.kernel.org and that is down so nothing will come of that for a while. Is there anything I can do other than waiting for a relevant kernel patch? Other than writing said patch myself of course.
PS I found in another thread that it works fine on PS/2 but my motherboard lacks a PS/2 port.

item.title: Problem with linux - shift, ctrl, alt etc keys not working
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Could try. I actually think my mobo came with a usb hub with ps/2, if not I can always get a pci ps/2 card for next to nothing!

Read full topic
item.source: Problem with linux - shift, ctrl, alt etc keys not working

item.title: Problem with linux - shift, ctrl, alt etc keys not working
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The only thing I can think of would be somewhat of a hack, you could do this:

keyboard -> (usb to ps/2 adapter) -> (ps/2 to usb adapter) -> computer

Meh.

Read full topic
item.source: Problem with linux - shift, ctrl, alt etc keys not working

item.title: Problem with linux - shift, ctrl, alt etc keys not working
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Err yes the motherboard lacks a PS/2 slot(huge disappointment). The keyboard doesn’t do anything particularly non-standard which is the thing, but the right windows key was reassigned to a function key that is used for some multimedia keys but that shouldn’t affect shift, ctrl, alt etc. The keyboard works fine in OSX, the problem seems to be with the usbhid driver in Linux.

Read full topic
item.source: Problem with linux - shift, ctrl, alt etc keys not working

item.title: Problem with linux - shift, ctrl, alt etc keys not working
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

What does that keyboard do so non-standard that Linux doesn’t support it? That’s odd.

Also, do you mean your motherboard lacks a PS/2 port? Because you can probably just put an adapter on your keyboard.

Read full topic
item.source: Problem with linux - shift, ctrl, alt etc keys not working

item.title: Problem with linux - shift, ctrl, alt etc keys not working
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Yeah, I facepalmed after I saw the website.

It uses cherry mx brown switches and all the other mechanical keyboards with brown switches were out of stock so it was my only choice.

Read full topic
